reviews.text: Phenomenal food and service! Mikhail was extremely helpful and gave an amazing wine selection! The food melted in our mouths and I definitely recommend the Porterhouse for two! Will definitely be returning here within the next few weeks because it was just that good!!!
Never disappoint  always  ğŸ’¯  one of top 3 steakhouse  there first

We went Saturday 10/18 - 8 pm reservation for our 4th wedding anniversary and we canâ€™t wait for the next reason to come back .
No crowd at all it was wonderful ,the atmosphere was quaint and quiet . Just enough to hear the person at your table

Andrzej was our server , he was attentive enough to know when we needed him and when we didnâ€™t and that was something we love at establishments, so this was a plus . Especially since it was our anniversary and the table talk was that important.

We started with the following drinks . And let me tell you the bartender did not disappoint.
I had a French martini and I never had one and it was delicious , not too sweet and Iâ€™m not a raspberry girl but it was amazing . The hint of vanilla was amazing , Iâ€™d definitely order it again .
My husband had a Raspberry peach margarita , I wouldâ€™ve liked it without raspberry but also delicious.

Second round
Peach cosmo , wasnâ€™t a fan too sweet just my taste but it was a good drink .
Lynchburgâ€™s lemonade was almost like a Jack Danielâ€™s Lemonade and it got the spot , so refreshing and not skimped on the alcohol either.
Drinks service 10/10

Next was appetizers
Caesar salad , now I read the reviews and still gave it a try and they were right . It has a hint of Russian dressing to it , was not a fan & probably wouldnâ€™t order it again . Didnâ€™t give the traditional taste to me .
Calamari , yea give me 10 of them ,add some banana peppers and we got a deal . They were airy and light and the batter was delicious.
Grilled bacon -  This was a game changer for me , Iâ€™m going to need to order two next time . Yes that good , Smokey flavor and that sauce that came with it paired so well .

Entree

Porterhouse for two grilled to a perfection of medium rare , it was amazing.
We made sure to take the bone home to our dog
The char was perfection , it was fork tender even the day after
We paired them with the lobster mac and cheese which was so tender juicy and decadent. And the roasted potatoes with onion and peppers , it gave off home fries vibes and I was not a fan . I expected roasted potatoes in half maybe with the skin still on.

We ended the night with crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e which had a faint hint of lemon that I was not a fan of and tossed the traditional taste out the window and the espresso ice cream which was decadent and delicious .

The service was 10/10
Overall meal withe nuances 9/10

Iâ€™m definitely coming back !

Amber steakhouse is a beautiful restaurant with a friendly staff and a ritzy atmosphere. We came here on a date but we also saw families there so it was the best of both worlds. Our server was a very nice and attentive gentleman. The food was incredible, portion size was perfect, and the drinks were strong (a good thing) and delicious. Definitely would come back again.
Service and food is amazing. Been coming here for years. I typically frequent Peter Lugerâ€™s or Bryant & Cooper and this is same caliber.

Second time coming here celebrated a friends birthdayâ€¦and I swear itâ€™s just that good. Porterhouse for 3 was perfect the asparagus always hit.. the staff from boss lady to the bar all attentive. Intimate space. Great food. Will always come back and recommend!
Absolutely the best steak house in the neighborhood. Peter Luger included!

Been coming here for over a decade, I cannot stress enough how amazing this place is. Why go to Peter Luger when you can come here and have as good a steak if not better in a chilled relaxed beautiful atmosphere with the most perfect staff! This place has an amazing array of side dishes, great wine list and meat that will melt in your mouth! Bravo 10 stars! See you guys soon!
Chris was very attentive and the food was delicious rite down to the dessert
Great steak , wine, bacon ğŸ¥“,  and rack of lamb

When they first opened we would go frequently but over the years with the opening of Raizes a Portuguese restaurant known for freshest seafood a block away Iâ€™ve noticed that Amber has completely copied Raizes menu from grilled oysters,â€¦
Overall very good ğŸ‘

Did not like the service. I felt rushed. The servers were moving really fast pertaining to everything. Appetizers took long to come out. The entrees took even longer. I came with a party of 8 everyone had some sort of gripe with this establishment.  My food was not good at all. I order the strip with shrimp and scampi sauce. Shrimp was really dry and I have never had a more tasteless scampi sauce. It tasted like water and steak drippings. The steak was flavorless as well. I don't like seasoned steak aside from salt and pepper..  The steak didn't do for me at all.Never been to a steakhouse where the steak was not the star. Never going back to Amber Steakhouse. Oh and that beet stuffed apple was horrible.  I had high hopes for it.
Cozy restaurant in a busy Greenpoint neighborhood. Steak and Fries were delicious as was the calamari and prawns. Was not the cheapest but worth it.
Super. To juÅ¼ drugie extra miejsce dla smakoszy steak's na Brooklynie. Stara gwardia specjalistÃ³w PolakÃ³w z sercem na dÅ‚oni oddaje tam swoje Å¼ycie z pasjÄ… sÅ‚uÅ¼Ä…c klientom. Brawo â¤ï¸
Bravo ğŸ¤ŒğŸ½â€¦â€¦ What a gem! Top steakhouse on my list. 10/10
Andrew you're the man.   Always on top of your game.   Chef Patrick my hats off to you.    Luciano was great as well.   We'll be back for more of that awesome porterhouse.
This place is fantastic! All the food was cooked perfectly! The waiter was great. Have him a great tip! Hats off to the chef! It was a great dinner and would highly recommend it!
WspaniaÅ‚e klimatyczne miejsce. ObsÅ‚uga miÄ™dzynarodowa. Polecam stek z brukselkÄ…

Excelente restaurante grill fora do circuito tradicional. Localizado no Brooklin na avenida Nassau. T-bone Ã³timo. Servido por um Ã³timo staff , imigrantes poloneses. Todos muito simpÃ¡ticos e atenciosos

Wonderful dinner from every perspective. We ordered arugula salad, fries calamari, porterhouse, amber seafood plate, and a side of fries. Excellent sauces for fried calamari, really bring out different tastes, well balanced salad, refreshing and crisp; nicely done porterhouse (move over Peter Lugar's) , crispy fries. A hearty grilled seafood and delightful variety. meticulous service: warm bread, soft butter, clean table between courses, don't stack plates in front of your nose- these should have been basic yet very rarely found these days. We had a great dinner and definitely want to come back again soon!
Elegancko, miÅ‚o i przepysznie. Porterhouse genialny. Tatar przepyszny. Do tego Å›wieÅ¼utkie buÅ‚eczki i zimne piwko polecone przez bardzo miÅ‚Ä… obsÅ‚ugÄ™. Polecamy bardzo.
Wonderful restaurant. Their porterhouse is fantastic, so is their bacon. Their house drinks are very creative with a wonderful blend of tastes.
Another great traditional steakhouse. I got the 24 ounce ribeye with a few sides.
A MUST. The food was delicious. Service was hospitable, helpful, not overbearing and attentive.

Disappointed After High Hopes

I came here after seeing a video on Instagram that made the foodâ€”especially the steak and mac and cheeseâ€”look amazing. Unfortunately, the experience didnâ€™t live up to the hype. The service was lackluster, and both the porterhouse steak and mac and cheese were seriously underwhelming. Do yourself a favor and take your money to Benjamin Steakhouse insteadâ€”youâ€™ll get much better service and food that actually delivers on quality.
Excellent hospitality.
Amber is always our go to for my dads birthday! Food is always incredible and you canâ€™t go wrong with the porterhouse for 3!
Just lovely. A quintessential NYC steakhouse in the best neighborhood. And some of the friendliest and warmest service.
Very professional and courteous staff. Food cooked to your liking
Rude hostess ("the owner's daughter") who hung up on me over the phone & proceded to refuse service unless the laptop was put away. meanwhile it's friday night & the place is half empty.
Food is very good, Service is not bad
Staff was friendly,  ambiance was great, food was amazing
Food was amazing. Service was amazing and everything felt like it was done with care and purpose. You donâ€™t have to dress up and it felt very inviting. Weâ€™ll be back for sure!
Great but over priced
Love this place! Itâ€™s such a classic New York steakhouse and everything is exceptional from the ambiance to the food. Definitely worth a visit!
One of the best T-bone steaks Iâ€™ve ever had. Super tender, very well seasoned plus very welcoming service.  10/10 would recommend
Great steakhouse, serving real Porterhouse, not cheated out of filet. Nice beer and wine selection. Vegetarians in the meat lover party will also not be disappointed.

It was my first time in a Polish steak house. I am very positively surprised. First of all, you have to try the bacon - exquisite taste. Salmon tartare is simply delicate and delicious. Excellent grilled octopus. cooked to perfection. And the steaks are already poetry. Real perfection of cooking. waiters who know the answer to every culinary question. This is a place you have to visit and eat.

Delicious menu and welcoming service. Ordered the burrata and gnocchi, Caesar salad, ny strip, baked potato, asparagus, crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e, espresso ice cream, earl grey tea and a cappuccino. Everything was great but we were especially surprised by the burrata (baby tomato, pine nuts, pesto and apricot was a refreshing change from basic caprese) and the well-executed char on the steak which went well with the house made steak sauce. The service was great, personalized and kind. The atmosphere was relaxing yet luxurious. The interior of the restaurant is very pretty and feels classic. We asked for a window seat in our reservation and enjoyed the view. Great first time experience for our special night. Iâ€™d love to try their diverse seafood selection next time. Thanks again!

What a GEM of a restaurant. We stumbled on Amber after trying to go to Bernieâ€™s, and we were SO glad we did, as Amber is a 10/10! The food was exquisite and the service was so welcoming, accommodating (we had two babies with us), and generous. Our EXCELLENT server told us he has to move back to Equador, and it broke our hearts, as he was a sincerely lovely human. We had the octupus, Boston salad, Caesar salad, the bacon (omg), Porterhouse for two, filet and shrimp, the 8oz filet, and various sides. Everything was BUSSIN. We canâ€™t wait to return, and we will miss our server!
I never rate anything 5 starsâ€¦ this was perfection!!
Excellent classic steakhouse with fantastic service
Great steaks!  Sides and deserts were alright service was great!
A real affordable steak house. We met Patrick the chef who is a hard-working and friendly individual. I recommend this place to everyone.
Save your hard earned coin. Service was horrible, and the food was even worse. The price has nothing to do with it. Just no flavor and super dry. BUT! The cocktails were amazing
It was best steak I ve ever had . Speechless service was great too salmon tartare was great wines was delicious.. a little bit pricey but worth ğŸ˜€ğŸ«¶ğŸ»
Great service, amazing food. You gotta eat here at least once in your lifetime

A restaurant with an excellent atmosphere in a nice neighborhood and the steak is extremely soft and juicy!!!!! Best steak house I've ever been to!!!I think i found a perfect gem in new york!!!

í‹°ë³¸ ê³ ê¸°ëŠ” ë¶€ë“œëŸ¬ì› ì§€ë§Œ ë¹¨ë¦¬ë¨¹ê³  ê°€ë¼ëŠ”ë“¯í•œ ì„œë¹™
ìŠ¤í…Œì´í¬ ë§›ë‚˜ìš”

Donâ€™t let TikTok fool you!!
My mate and I went to celebrate our anniversary and it definitely ruined the celebration. Donâ€™t get me wrong, the decor and interior was really nice and
Chic. The servers were really attentive and personable but the food is a whole other ballgame. The lemon drop cocktail was the star of this show. The calamari was bland and lukewarm. I ordered the creamed spinach which tasted bland and a bit freezer burnt . The spinach had the worst after taste. The lobster Mac and cheese was runny and grainy. You can tell a roux was the main point in making this mac and cheese but it was so underwhelming. The lobster Mac and cheese was extremely disappointing. My surf and turf was pretty good but a bit on the cold side. The waiter traded out the lobster Mac and cheese for mashed potato but when he brought it out they were ice cube cold (lowkey like vanilla icecream).
The only hot thing was my mates steak which they took back and replaced when they realized he was shaking the table trying to cut into the steak that was supposed to medium and not overly well done. He was shaking the table so hard all we could do was apologize to the patrons next to us and laugh embarrassingly lol. The manager was nice and understanding but nothing was taken off the bill for our less than stellar experience. Very disappointed in my first visit here. Doubt Iâ€™ll come back.
Great steakhouse. The food was really good, drinks were very tasty too. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Only downside is that it is very expensive for what you get.

Our date experience for 2
We were excited to try Amberâ€™s Steakhouse as it had been on our list to try out for a while. Unfortunately, we have to report it was an overall mediocre experience. Letâ€™s start with the service, we felt it was quite rushed and abrupt. The way our waitress splashed the oil of our sizzling porterhouse steak all over the table was of course accidental, but the response to it not very professional.  Some of the oil came on my jacket which I found out about later.
Then the food, it was honestly very average, whereby the steak was OK but we definitely had better. The creamed spinach (oh my!) was definitely not freshly made and tasted like it was from a package. The mashed potato were OK, a bit bland. The mushrooms however were quite good.
The drinks: I ordered a Margarita cocktail, which I wouldnâ€™t recommend.
The cherry on the cake though was really the totally weird trance/techno-playlist from the early 2000Â´s (whatâ€™s going on there?), the price was around $280, so we had expected quite a better experience for this amount.  We left wondering what really went wrong here.

Amazing experience! My friend and I came to celebrate her birthday. Right away, we were taken care of. Our server Damian was very attentive. The food was so good! For appetizers, we had the grilled bacon and the fried calamari. It was AMAZING! For our entree, we had the 20 oz rib eye and the full rack of lamb chops. Great portions!

My husband and I LOVE steak and this place has popped up on my IG a few times so we decided to give it a try.  Itâ€™s 45 mins from us and with traffic it took us about 3 hours round trip.  And for 3 hours, the food was good, but we wouldnâ€™t make the trip back again.  There isnâ€™t really anything I could point out specifically as badâ€¦it just missing something that would make it a wow 5 star meal.  There werenâ€™t a ton of people in the place when we went and we got stat sorta in a skinny walkway where all the staff had to walk so we felt a bit cramped.  I think we could have been seated in many other seats to not be seated squished against a wall.  The drinks were nice and strong, I got the filet and my husband got a bone in ribeye.  We split French fries.  Both steaks were cooked to our liking but againâ€¦it wasnâ€™t anything I couldnâ€™t get from a steakhouse that isnâ€™t 45 mins away from us.  But if you want reliably well cooked and tasty steaks, you can trust youâ€™ll get that here!

It was a great experience.  The food was good and the staff friendly and professional.  Everything we ordered was delicious.  Not salty.. The grilled octopus was made just right.  We ordered a lot of salads and seafood dishes and they wereâ€¦

Best bacon I've ever had! We ordered the Porterhouse for 3, Caesar salad, mashed potatoes, shrimp cocktail, mac and cheese, and grilled salmon. Everything was delicious!!! Service was impeccable as well. You can't go wrong here.

Iâ€™m glad I didnâ€™t listen to the bad reviews. The food was great, the service was even better ! We had a mix of different people the servers treated us like family!!! Will definitely go again. I guess if u go anyplace with a negative attitude u will get negative results.

Premium steakhouse in the heart of Greenpoint, Brooklyn offering up quality seafood, sandwiches and steaks including full bar with fantastic cocktails. Professional service every step of our dining service and definitely would recommend.

Great for special occasions.

Amazing food and great service! I got the T bone steak while my husband got the bone in ribeye. Both were cooked exactly how we liked in and we literally finished almost the entire thing. They also had their own house gravy which was a perfect complement to the steaks. We definitely recommend this restaurant if youâ€™re ever in the Brooklyn area and craving delicious steak!

Came here for a six year wedding anniversary after our original plans fell through. Call them at 9:20 to get a 9:45 reservations nÃ© they were incredibly accommodating! From the moment we stepped in and got seated, we were taken care of by the phenomenal waiter, Kris. Our drinks came out quickly and weâ€™re delicious, the complimentary bread and apps came out hot and fast. For our main course, it was the same things: well prepared, seasoned phenomenally, and was quick to our table! I feel as though the money youâ€™re putting into this meal experience is well worth it, off the food alone but more importantly worth it for the attention to detail and care from the staff. Will be back for more!

A wonderful steak house. My family & I came in for my stepfatherâ€™s birthday and everything was wonderful. We ordered the petite steak, seafood pasta dish and a couple of sides. The food was pretty good and portioned well. I believe our server was Chris? He checked in on us and gave great table service. We loved the ambiance and the attention to detail also. Will definitely be back for that sizzling porterhouse!

Iâ€™ve eaten better ribeye steak for almost half the price at Longhorn Steakhouse than here. My friend and I both ordered 20 oz ribeyes and both were not cooked to our liking. See attached for what was supposed to be a medium rare. The center of the steak was almost too rare to even eat. Otherwise, the restaurantâ€™s fine for what it is, nothing special. Apps were decent. Wouldnâ€™t come back here again as we werenâ€™t satisfied with what we paid for.

What can I say about Amber steakhouse? Food service friendly atmosphere very attentive staff very inviting warm environment. Almost like an old-school steakhouse. The food was excellent. The party I was with we had bacon filet mignon ribeye, gnocchi, cream, spinach, mashed potatoes and we finished our great meal with a slice of carrot cake. The overall experience was fun and energetic. The noise level was medium, but really picked up as the night went on because it became really crowded but overall a positive atmosphere and what can I say about the attentive staff the minute you walk in youâ€™re greeted warmly and the server and service are professional and attentive while it is a little above average when it comes to the expensive of the meal, but for an occasional treat, itâ€™s definitely worth the price very tasty well cooked to perfection food with all this is a worthy offbeat and path, Brooklyn steakhouse I would highly recommend it above even some of the old-school ones throughout New York City. Great for friends, family and romantic nights

My recent visit to Amber Steak House left me with conflicting feelings, as the overall experience was a tale of two halves. While the food, service, and ambiance were exceptional, the initial encounter with the hostess left much to be desired.

Upon entering, I was greeted by a less-than-friendly hostess whose demeanor seemed to lack warmth and hospitality. Her lackadaisical attitude was an unexpected start to what turned out to be an otherwise delightful evening. It's worth noting that first impressions matter, and unfortunately, this one didn't set the best tone for the evening.

However, as soon as we were seated, the atmosphere of Amber Steak House began to work its magic. The ambiance was sophisticated, with a blend of modern aesthetics and a cozy, inviting feel. The dim lighting and tasteful decor created an intimate setting, perfect for a dinner outing.

The menu featured an array of steak options, and our server was not only knowledgeable but also passionate about the offerings. Their recommendations were spot-on, and the food that followed was nothing short of excellent. Each dish was expertly prepared, showcasing the chef's skill and a commitment to quality ingredients. From the perfectly cooked steaks to the delectable sides, every bite was a testament to the culinary expertise in the kitchen.

Service throughout the meal was attentive without being intrusive. Our server demonstrated a keen understanding of pacing, ensuring that we felt well taken care of without feeling rushed. The staff's dedication to ensuring a positive dining experience was evident, and it significantly contributed to the overall enjoyment of the evening.

In spite of the rocky start with the hostess, the outstanding quality of the food, the impeccable service, and the inviting ambiance ultimately won me over. While the initial encounter could use improvement, the exceptional aspects of Amber Steak House managed to shine through, leaving me with a positive overall impression. I would recommend this establishment to fellow food enthusiasts, with the hope that the front-of-house staff can match the excellence demonstrated by their culinary counterparts.

Super pricy for such a tiny amount of scallops. 2 for like $25 seems like a scam to me. The mussels on the other hand were great. Wife had the chicken and loved it, i have the porter house for 2 as reminded by my waiter. Who doesn't like little leftover steak for lunch?? Either way all around good experience.

Not all the best steakhouses are in Manhattan. Amber steakhouse is a great classic steakhouse located right in Brooklyn. The traditional steakhouse atmosphere and menu,  food was cooked perfectly excellent martinis and service.

We have been to several steakhouses in Brooklyn and  surrounding areas and i must say we really enjoyed our dinner here. The quality of the steak was superb  and it was prepared well.  The spinach complimented the steak will and the french onion soup was one of the better ones we have hadbin terms of flavorful broth and quality cheese. The staff were pleasant and the service was timely. My only word of caution if you will, is to make reservations and arrive early if your going for a more intimate diningexperience. The restaurant isnt huge and many of the seats are along the walkway which means you may have to wait for something specific if you didn't reserve ahead of time.

Came here for my brotherâ€™s birthday. Very nice ambiance and great food. Service was great. Our server was very detail oriented and I loved that. I do wish though, he hadnâ€™t rushed me with my food order. We had already placed the order forâ€¦
Amazing atmosphere, professional stuff, food was delicious - we order duck leg, onion soup, calamari for appetizers and at the end cream bulle and ice cream. Love it all. We definitely coming back.

One of the best steakhouses in all of NYC. We started with the Sea scallop and grilled bacon appetizers. I got the 24oz Bone in ribeye and my lady got the fillet mignon with the foie gras, and we finished with Creme Brule and Carrot cake. From the beginning to the end of the meal every single thing I tasted was better than the previous bite, overall one of the best meals I've ever had in my life, and I'm fat so I've eaten a hell of a lot of food. But the best part of the meal was the service, sadly I forget the server's name but he was excellent, incredibly helpful, and insightful about how to pair different elements of the meal with the appropriate beverage. The attention to detail that is put into the space and the food is to be commended. One of NYC's best-kept secrets and I'll be going back.

I went here for my birthday, and the whole restaurant should get a Michelin star! It was amazing! The service was excellent, the food was spectacular, and atmosphere was perfect. I highly recommend getting the steak sandwich, the night's highlight!

Est. 2010

Layout/atmosphere
*Elegant (chandeliers, white table cloths, red & gold curtains, soft music); tables; old fashioned bar in middle of the restaurant (no seating)

Service
*Good; waiters in shirts, vests & black ties

Food/drink
*Sea Scallops (Avocado Mashed Potatoes, Madeira Truffle Sauce) - Good; tender fish; creamy potatoes; sweet sauce
*Filet Mignon (8 oz) with Foie Gras (bordelaise sauce) - Good; creaminess from the foie gras
*Gnocchi with butter, chives & truffle oil - OK; nothing noteworthy
*Complimentary dinner roll (onion) with butter

Very good stakehouse. You can smell the meat as soon as you walk in.  Little on expensive side, nothing to free here, will have to pay for side dishes as well.  Overall very nice experience and great quality food.

I made reservations at this place for my best friend's birthday. We arrived on time and were seated immediately. The restaurant is actually pretty small and cramped which it doesn't look like in pictures. Anyway, for appetizers we order the fried calamari and French onion soup . The Calamari was decent and the French onion soup was fair. For entrees, I ordered the Rib Eye with the bone with broccoli and mashed potatoes and my friend ordered the T-Bone with mashed potatoes and asparagus. The steaks were very thick but flavorful even though we both ordered medium rare and they both came out rare. The knives they have to cut the steaks are not real steak knives so it feels like you're sawing away trying to slice it. The mashed potatoes were decent for both of us but the broccoli was hard and the asparagus was bland. All in all, nothing in this place wowed me not even the service! And For the price point of this place I would not come back.

And to top it off, after I signed the check and got up from the table to walk out, our waitress decided to grab me and tell me that the tip I gave "was a mistake" and not enough! Her exact words "I think you made a mistake , we make $3.20 an hour, you need to tip more". I asked her was the tip amount mandatory and she told me "yes". However that was a lie! Even on the receipt it says that it's "suggested". This is the same waitress who barely said a word to us, barely smiled, and rushed us throughout our dinner. I watched her spark up conversations with all her other tables but not us! She's lucky she got the amount I gave her! I told her she's needs to give better service to her black customers and walked away! Never again will I step foot back there, the food isn't even that great!
